intro: Gamanthus kelifii, commonly known as the Kelifii gamanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments through deep root systems and water-storing tissues. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
